bug.author: Dibel
bug.summary: tensorflow package for python3 not found in tensorflow-1.14.0-notebook-gpu:0.7.0
bug.description:
/kind bug What steps did you take and what happened: Try to set up a notebook with image gcr.io/kubeflow-images-public/tensorflow-1.14.0-notebook-gpu:v0.7.0 in kubeflow 0.7. But this image contains both python2 and python3 runtime, and tensorflow only exists in python2 runtime. In container's terminal I run python --version got the following output: Python 2.7.15+ pip list got the following output:
Click to expand DEPRECATION: Python 2.7 will reach the end of its life on January 1st, 2020. Please upgrade your Python as Python 2.7 won't be maintained after that date. A future version of pip will drop support for Python 2.7. Package Version ---------------------------------- ----------- absl-py 0.7.1 asn1crypto 0.24.0 astor 0.8.0 attrs 19.1.0 backports-abc 0.5 backports.functools-lru-cache 1.5 backports.shutil-get-terminal-size 1.0.0 backports.weakref 1.0.post1 bleach 3.1.0 configparser 3.7.4 crcmod 1.7 cryptography 2.1.4 cycler 0.10.0 decorator 4.4.0 defusedxml 0.6.0 entrypoints 0.3 enum34 1.1.6 funcsigs 1.0.2 functools32 3.2.3.post2 futures 3.2.0 gast 0.2.2 google-pasta 0.1.7 grpcio 1.21.1 h5py 2.9.0 idna 2.6 ipaddress 1.0.17 ipykernel 4.10.0 ipython 5.8.0 ipython-genutils 0.2.0 ipywidgets 7.4.2 Jinja2 2.10.1 jsonschema 3.0.1 jupyter 1.0.0 jupyter-client 5.2.4 jupyter-console 5.2.0 jupyter-core 4.5.0 jupyter-http-over-ws 0.0.6 Keras-Applications 1.0.8 Keras-Preprocessing 1.1.0 keyring 10.6.0 keyrings.alt 3.0 kiwisolver 1.1.0 Markdown 3.1.1 MarkupSafe 1.1.1 matplotlib 2.2.4 mistune 0.8.4 mock 3.0.5 nbconvert 5.5.0 nbformat 4.4.0 notebook 5.7.8 numpy 1.16.4 pandocfilters 1.4.2 pathlib2 2.3.3 pexpect 4.7.0 pickleshare 0.7.5 pip 19.1.1 prometheus-client 0.7.1 prompt-toolkit 1.0.16 protobuf 3.8.0 ptyprocess 0.6.0 pycrypto 2.6.1 Pygments 2.4.2 pygobject 3.26.1 pyparsing 2.4.0 pyrsistent 0.15.2 python-dateutil 2.8.0 pytz 2019.1 pyxdg 0.25 pyzmq 18.0.1 qtconsole 4.5.1 scandir 1.10.0 SecretStorage 2.3.1 Send2Trash 1.5.0 setuptools 41.0.1 simplegeneric 0.8.1 singledispatch 3.4.0.3 six 1.11.0 subprocess32 3.5.4 tensorboard 1.14.0 tensorflow-estimator 1.14.0 tensorflow-gpu 1.14.0 termcolor 1.1.0 terminado 0.8.2 testpath 0.4.2 tornado 5.1.1 traitlets 4.3.2 wcwidth 0.1.7 webencodings 0.5.1 Werkzeug 0.15.4 wheel 0.30.0 widgetsnbextension 3.4.2 wrapt 1.11.2 WARNING: You are using pip version 19.1.1, however version 19.3.1 is available. You should consider upgrading via the 'pip install --upgrade pip' command.
pip3 list got the following output:
Click to expand DEPRECATION: The default format will switch to columns in the future. You can use --format=(legacy|columns) (or define a format=(legacy|columns) in your pip.conf under the [list] section) to disable this warning. argo-models (2.2.1a0) asn1crypto (0.24.0) attrs (19.1.0) backcall (0.1.0) bleach (3.1.0) cachetools (3.1.1) certifi (2019.9.11) cffi (1.12.3) chardet (3.0.4) Click (7.0) cloudpickle (1.2.2) cryptography (2.7) decorator (4.4.0) defusedxml (0.6.0) docker (4.0.2) entrypoints (0.3) fairing (0.5) future (0.17.1) google-api-core (1.14.2) google-api-python-client (1.7.11) google-auth (1.6.3) google-auth-httplib2 (0.0.3) google-cloud-core (1.0.3) google-cloud-storage (1.20.0) google-resumable-media (0.4.1) googleapis-common-protos (1.6.0) httplib2 (0.14.0) idna (2.8) ipykernel (5.1.2) ipython (7.8.0) ipython-genutils (0.2.0) jedi (0.15.1) Jinja2 (2.10.1) json5 (0.8.5) jsonschema (3.0.2) jupyter-client (5.3.3) jupyter-console (6.0.0) jupyter-core (4.5.0) jupyterlab (1.1.4) jupyterlab-server (1.0.6) kfp (0.1.22) kfp-server-api (0.1.18.3) kubernetes (10.0.1) MarkupSafe (1.1.1) mistune (0.8.4) nbconvert (5.6.0) nbformat (4.4.0) notebook (6.0.1) numpy (1.17.2) oauth2client (4.1.3) oauthlib (3.1.0) pandocfilters (1.4.2) parso (0.5.1) pexpect (4.7.0) pickleshare (0.7.5) pip (9.0.1) prometheus-client (0.7.1) prompt-toolkit (2.0.9) protobuf (3.9.2) ptyprocess (0.6.0) pyasn1 (0.4.7) pyasn1-modules (0.2.6) pycparser (2.19) Pygments (2.4.2) pygobject (3.26.1) PyJWT (1.7.1) pyrsistent (0.15.4) python-apt (1.6.4) python-dateutil (2.8.0) pytz (2019.2) PyYAML (5.1.2) pyzmq (18.1.0) requests (2.22.0) requests-oauthlib (1.2.0) requests-toolbelt (0.9.1) rsa (4.0) scipy (1.3.1) Send2Trash (1.5.0) setuptools (39.0.1) six (1.12.0) tabulate (0.8.3) terminado (0.8.2) testpath (0.4.2) tornado (5.1.1) traitlets (4.3.2) uritemplate (3.0.0) urllib3 (1.24.3) wcwidth (0.1.7) webencodings (0.5.1) websocket-client (0.56.0) xgboost (0.90)
What did you expect to happen: Only python3 runtime exists in the image, and tensorflow should be useable in python3. Anything else you would like to add: Everything worked well in tensorflow-1.15.0-notebook-gpu:v-base-e60ee44-1186280489095270404 Environment:
Kubeflow version: 0.7.0 kfctl version: v0.7.0 Kubernetes platform: bare metal Kubernetes version:
<denchmark-code>Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"15", GitVersion:"v1.15.3", GitCommit:"2d3c76f9091b6bec110a5e63777c332469e0cba2", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-08-19T11:05:50Z", GoVersion:"go1.12.9", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"} </denchmark-code>
OS: CentOS Linux 7 (Core)

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.94. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Dibel>@Dibel</denchmark-link> Thanks for reporting this problem. We are working on it. Sorry for the inconvenience.
After <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/pull/4478>#4478</denchmark-link> is merged we will need to build a new image and move the 0.7.0 tag.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Tabrizian>@Tabrizian</denchmark-link> do we have an updated jupyter image that we can tag? gcr.io/kubeflow-images-public/tensorflow-1.14.0-notebook-gpu:v0.7.0 is currently pointing to sha256:895aa500ff09c9080e0755044e4fd9a3bd3dc3ae403415e220ebcc1dab09b6ef Looks like it was built on october 10. v-base-ef41372-1177829795472347138 There's a newer image gcr.io/kubeflow-images-public/tensorflow-1.14.0-notebook-gpu@sha256:0d4f11de65e23deac6c2e955b37aa5d549085f8ea1a03d696a3fff9f27d4df3f v-base-b813c9a-1184585142199390209
Looks like this image isn't new enough <denchmark-code>git log -1 --format='%ci' b813c9a 2019-10-16 14:40:41 -0700 git log -1 --format='%ci' 884a0c51 2019-11-07 06:19:09 -0800 </denchmark-code>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jlewi>@jlewi</denchmark-link> The has not been updated but I created a pull request for . The pull request is here: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/pull/4352>#4352</denchmark-link>
